org.ljtoolkit.data
Class Challenge

java.lang.Object
  org.ljtoolkit.data.Challenge

public class Challenge
extends java.lang.Object

The Challenge class represents the returned response from the Live Journal server on a getchallenge request.

Author:
Troy Bourdon

getChallenge

public java.lang.String getChallenge()
Returns the challange string to generate a hashed response from.

Returns:
challange string which is used to generate a hashed response

setChallenge

public void setChallenge(java.lang.String challenge)
An opaque cookie to generate a hashed response from.

Parameters:
challenge -

getSuccess

public java.lang.String getSuccess()
OK on success or FAIL when there's an error. When there's an error, see errmsg for the error text. The absence of this variable should also be considered an error.

Returns:
success status

setSuccess

public void setSuccess(java.lang.String success)
Setter for the success attribute.

Parameters:
success - status

getErrMsg

public java.lang.String getErrMsg()
The error message if success was FAIL, not present if OK. If the success variable isn't present, this variable most likely won't be either (in the case of a server error), and clients should just report "Server Error, try again later.

Returns:
error message

setErrMsg

public void setErrMsg(java.lang.String errMsg)
Setter for the errMsg attribute.

Parameters:
errMsg - error message

getAuthScheme

public java.lang.String getAuthScheme()
You can ignore this for now. By default this is the highest version of our authentication schemes, if in the future Live Journal implements other auth schemes or change the default. In that case LJ would add a new capabilities exchange: your client could say, "I know c0 and c1", and our server would then say, "Use c1, it's the best."

Returns:
authentication scheme

setAuthScheme

public void setAuthScheme(java.lang.String authScheme)
This method will be used internally to set the authentication scheme of the challenge as returned from a call to the LiveJournalService getChallenge method.

Parameters:
authScheme - The authentication scheme

getExpireTime

public java.util.Date getExpireTime()
The expiration time of the challenge, as measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

Returns:
expiration time.

setExpireTime

public void setExpireTime(java.util.Date expireTime)
This method will be used internally to set the expiration time of the challenge as returned from a call to the LiveJournalService getChallenge method.

Parameters:
expireTime - The expiration time

getServerTime

public java.util.Date getServerTime()
The server time when the challenge was generated, as measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

Returns:
date/time of the Live Journal server

setServerTime

public void setServerTime(java.util.Date serverTime)
This method will be used internally to set the time of the Live Journal server which was returned from a call to the LiveJournalService getChallenge method.

Parameters:
serverTime - The Live Journal server time.
